ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] I have an ARC that kills the arcreader
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Can I have your ARC Tom?   Might give clue on how the records were constructed. Thanks, St.Ack P.S. You got note on questions for the archive pass

Tom Emerson wrote:

> I have an ARC file (generated from an ongoing crawl using a recent
> HEAD snapshot) that causes the arcreader to  die:
>
> Exception in thread "main" java.util.NoSuchElementException: class 
> java.io.IOException: Header line longer than max allowed  -- 102400 -- 
> or passed buffer doesn't contain a line.
>         at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.next(ARCReader.java:325)
>         at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.index(ARCReader.java:605)
>         at org.archive.io.arc.ARCReader.main(ARCReader.java:715)
>
> I found this while working with my libarc rewrite --- the ARC file in
> question caused my code to crash too.
>
> Investigation shows that the problem is that there are a number (46 of
> 28658) of records that have an uncompressed length of 0. libarc didn't
> expect this, and evidently neither does ARCReader. Interestingly
> enough the ARC itself is structured just fine: I can walk and
> uncompress all of the records in the file except the 0 length ones.
>
> Any one have an idea how the 0 length records make it into the ARC?
> I'm going to code around this right now, but I thought I'd ask.
>
Can I have your ARC Tom?   Might give clue on how the records were 
constructed.
Thanks,
St.Ack
P.S. You got note on questions for the 'archive pass' project?
